If an item is defined by a macro, how can I get the span of the place where the macro is expanded? I tried using rustc_span::hygiene::walk_chain in the same way as Codegen Cranelift seems to do, and it gives me back the span unchanged, still pointing at the code within the macro definition.

https://github.com/bjorn3/rustc_codegen_cranelift/blob/master/src/debuginfo/line_info.rs#L150

Never mind. After struggling with this long enough to post a question about it, I found a clue to what the context argument to walk_chain means, and that I have to give the root context, not the function context.
